results.title: The Magic Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dusan Marek, Eltham Films and Anim-ad Films
results.description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.
description_for_label: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: John Davis
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Shows the work of Victorian sculptor John Davis, who uses many unusual materials and concepts to create modern sculpture

results.title: Robert Rooney
results.creator_credit: Robert Rooney, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Rooney’s art is a personal analysis of his own life, and in examining his own idiosyncratic behaviour he is exploring the routines and obsessions that concern each and every one of us. These routines are perhaps meaningless to some, yet they consume a major part of our everyday life
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rooney, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Here They Know You
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
In country towns, opportunities for school leavers are limited. Diane and Peter have left school but don’t have jobs. They reflect on the relevance of school, the sense of community in a country town and the advantages of city and country life

results.title: Solar dawn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films
results.brief_description: Utilises many animation sequences to clearly show how basic solar collectors work. It shows how buildings can be heated and cooled by solar devices, and how city buildings and ordinary houses should be designed to take advantage of direct solar energy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films

results.title: High Hopes
results.brief_description: Lyn and Patrice leave school with definite plans for their careers. Following long periods unemployed they reassess their aspirations and finally accept jobs they didn’t really want.
